timeline.bodyText: FMPOV the cause (Throwable) should be logged here as intended by the OpenTracing spec, i.e. using Fields.ERROR_KIND and Fields.ERROR_OBJECT to be consistent with other cases where we use TracingHelper.log(Throwable). We might want to consider adding Fields.STACK to that method as well ...
timeline.author: sophokles73

replies.bodyText:
I think the stack is not important here. The log message is supposed to contain result.cause().toString().
Concerning the "ERROR_KIND" and "ERROR_OBJECT" fields: These would of course be set if  Tracing.logError was used here. I didn't want to use this because I didn't want the HTTP PUT span to be marked as an error span in this case (that wasn't done so before).
But thinking again, I think this case should indeed be marked as an error span, reflecting the "check message limit failed" error. I have adapted the commit accordingly, also setting an error for the "received invalid command message" case.
replies.author: calohmn

timeline.message:
Improve Command & Control related tracing.

The HTTP adapter now tracks the reception of a
command in a separate span.

Signed-off-by: Carsten Lohmann <carsten.lohmann@bosch.io>

timeline.bodyText: The command is invalid in this case, isn't it? Shouldn't this result in an error being logged to the span?
timeline.author: sophokles73

replies.bodyText: I see. Then FMPOV we should pull up the CommandConsumer.logReceivedCommandToSpan(command, waitForCommandSpan) invocation before the if (isCommandValid(command, waitForCommandSpan)) statement and explicitly log the fact that the request has already been processed and the command is being released. WDYT?
replies.author: sophokles73
